decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly by playing multiple spells in a turn and then use that mana to storm off with cards like Rite of Flame and Manamorphose. The deck aims to draw through the library with cards like Echo of Eons and Jeska's Will to find the win condition, which is usually activating Lion's Eye Diamond to cast a game-winning spell like Tendrils of Agony or Grapeshot. The deck also includes disruption like Defense Grid to protect the combo from countermagic and wish cards to get the specific cards needed to win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently get powerful creatures into the graveyard, then bring them back onto the battlefield using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. This combo allows the player to cheat big creatures into play early in the game, overwhelming the opponent. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. The deck aims to win through the sheer power of its reanimated creatures, creating a fast and aggressive strategy that can catch opponents off guard.

This control deck focuses on utilizing Leyline of the Guildpact to protect its permanents and creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. The deck aims to control the game through card advantage from Brainstorm and Ponder, while also ramping into powerful threats like Scion of Draco and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The inclusion of Glarb, Calamity's Augur and Broadside Bombardiers provides additional disruption and versatility. The mana base is designed to support a variety of spells and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on attacking aggressively with efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Broadside Bombardiers, while using tools like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Swords to Plowshares to control the board. The deck also includes cards like Esper Sentinel and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck has access to disruptive lands like Wasteland and Karakas to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of pressure and disruption.

The deck focuses on using a combination of fast mana (Lotus Petal, Chrome Mox) and creatures that can sacrifice themselves (Boggart Trawler, Poxwalkers) to quickly fill the graveyard. This enables powerful graveyard-based combos such as Dread Return on Balustrade Spy to mill the entire library and win with Thassa's Oracle or Fell the Profane. Cards like Pact of Negation and Chancellor of the Annex provide protection while Once Upon a Time helps find key pieces. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can react.

The deck revolves around quickly ramping up Goblin creatures onto the battlefield using Aether Vial, Goblin Lackey, and Rundvelt Hordemaster. It also utilizes cards like Mogg War Marshal and Munitions Expert to maintain board control and pressure opponents. With cards like Muxus, Goblin Grandee and Goblin Matron, the deck can easily tutor for key pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Goblins. The inclusion of Wasteland and Rishadan Port also provides disruption against opponents' mana bases, further solidifying the aggressive strategy of the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Helm of Obedience and Leyline of the Void combo, using cards like Reanimate and Beseech the Mirror to search for the necessary pieces. The deck also utilizes powerful disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach to control the opponent's hand. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator allows for additional utility and access to artifacts like The One Ring. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt and combo off quickly to secure a victory in the Legacy format.
